questions.question: Ismael: broke, not interst'd in land jobs, been a sailor B4 but not a whaler.  This explains...

His decision to share a room with a guy he doesn't know
His decision to choose the Pequod over two other ships
Write out his will after his first Nantucket Sleighride
Love of nature & the adventure in the book
Love of nature & everyone else's death in the book
Love of nature & his sentimentality for a Nantucket ship
Love of nature & onomatopoeia in the book

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an oxymoron?
Old man named Elijah seems 2 warn Ismael & Queequeg about Capt. Ahab.  Explain the allusion

choices.answer: Ref 2 history: names of heroes of the War for Independence
Ref 2 novel Of Mice and Men: names match boss of ranch & son
Ref 2 people in current events of 1851 when book was written
Ref 2 Bible: names of prophet & king match captain & old man
We see man vs. self conflict
We know Queequeg will be a dynamic character
We see foreshadowing with Capt. Ahab's character
The novel is written in the third person

questions.question: Because Elijah the prophet tried to warn King Ahab like the old man seems to warn Ismael...

choices.answer: We can say Elijah was correct about him
We can say Elijah was wrong about him
We can say that Moby Dick is a dynamic character
We can say that the novel is Romantic Literature

questions.question: Because Capt. Ahab has a monomaniacal fixation on taking revenge against  MbyDik above all else

choices.answer: cautious & reasonable / reckless & fun loving
reckless & fun loving / cautious & reasonable
very similar to Capt. Ahab / opposite of Capt. Ahab
All the above

questions.question: What does Flask have in common with Capt. Ahab

choices.answer: Flask lost his hand whaling, Ahab lost his leg whaling

They both hate whales and want to destroy them

Trying to motivate the crew w/ a visible reminder of a bonus

All the above

choices.answer: Queequeeg saw it as a good sign Starbuck saw it as a bad one
Sperm whales eat giant squid: part of their diet in the wild
Giant squid eat sperm whales: part of their diet in the wild
Starbuck saw it as a good sign Queequeeg saw it as a bad one

questions.question: Symbols in literature help you understand something else beside the symbol itself, so...

choices.answer: The storm symbolizes Ahab's fury because it's violent
Storm symbolizes Ahab's fury because it comes from the east
Symbolizes Ahab's fury because he's sailing the ship east
All of these
Become a whaler years ago as a young man
Hire Ismael and Queequeeg
See the giant squid as good sign not bad like Starbuck does
See St. Elmo's fire differently than the men do

choices.answer: His conversation with Starbuck

questions.question: How does it appear that Ahab knows he is going to die?
Because it appears Ahab knows he's going to die in his conversation with Starbuck...

choices.answer: It's irony
It's denouement
It's indirect characterization
It's foreshadowing

questions.question: How is the very end of the novel foreshadowed on the very first page?

choices.answer: Queequeeg is a Pacific Islander
Innkeeper's last name is Coffin when Ismael meets Queequeeg
The inn is decorated w/ whale bones & they're going whaling
Queequeeg's god Yojo predicts it
